result.execSummary:
The defendant Eraclio S. Olivares was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eraclio S. Olivares is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eraclio S. Olivares was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to Case #22-CF-458
123 days credit if revoked

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
Spend 12 months in the County Jail. May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Probation and Parole to notify Court, in writing, of: any arrests within 5 days of receipt of information, upon dirty UA's or proof of possession/consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

superTimeConds.notes: w/Huber authorized only after DE serves 50% of conditional sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eraclio S. Olivares

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: of DNA Collection at Conviction
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

2:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Eraclio S. Olivares in court, in custody.  Attorney David Patton in court for Eraclio S. Olivares. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF458/22CF756. Victim rights compliance. Victim address the Court. Sentencing arguments heard.

22CF458: 
Count 2: Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 6 years WSP; 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, defendant not eligible for SAP/CIP. Defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions; 12 months conditional jail w/Huber authorized only after the DE serves 50% of his conditional jail sentence. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court costs, DV surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

Count 3: Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 5 years WSP; 2 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, defendant not eligible for SAP/CIP; concurrent to count 2. Defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions; 12 months conditional jail w/Huber authorized only after the DE serves 50% of his conditional jail sentence. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court costs, DV surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

22CF756: Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 5 years WSP; 2 years initial confinement w/credit for 123 days served, 3 years extended supervision, defendant not eligible for SAP/CIP; consecutive to Case 22CF458. Defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions; 12 months conditional jail w/Huber authorized only after the DE serves 50% of his conditional jail sentence. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice given to def. in court. 

Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Defendant's Sentencing Memorandum submitted by Attorney Patton

AMENDED CONDITIONS
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Amanda M, Miranda B or their residences
CONTACT W/AMANDA M. IS ALLOWED WHILE DE IS IN CUSTODY, BUT, IFTHE DE POSTS BOND THE NO CONTACT W/AMANDA M. WILL BE IN PLACE.

01:41 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Eraclio S. Olivares, appeared in custody with Attorney David Patton.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF458/22CF756. Matter is resolved. The State places the agreement on the record.

22CF458:   Defendant entered a plea of no contest to count 2 and a plea of guilty to count 3; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 1 and 4-6 are dismissed.

22CF756:   Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 2 is dismissed.

Presentence Investigation ordered. Motion for De Novo Review filed by Attorney Patton. Arguments heard. Court modifies bond to allow contact with Amanda M. while the DE is in custody, but if the DE posts bond the no contact will be in place with Amanda M.. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for De Novo Review
Court has review the notarized letter from Amanda M. filed on 8/5/22.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Attorney David Patton in court with Defendant Eraclio S. Olivares who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU 
 Minutes:   DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.  Arguments made on DE's bond motion and motion is denied.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eraclio S. Olivares in court, in custody.  Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
